His research interest is regarding the decision support model.

title: MODES: Model for Determining Employee Salary
description: This DSM was developed using a multistage fuzzy logic method. This DSM uses 18 parameters, which are divided into four major categories: personal information, skills, attitudes, and experience. These 18 parameters are age, marital status, dependents, distance, skill understanding, job knowledge, speed of work, quantity of work, quality of work, attitude, discipline, responsibility, honesty, achievement, current position, current salary, and works experience.
author: Gregoryus Imannuel Perdana, S.Kom, M.Kom

title: MOSTART: Model for Startup Funding
description: The model was developed to suggest startup funding amount from private venture capital (PVC) and government venture capital (GVC) perspectives. The model process twenty-two parameters (fifthteen fuzzy and seven nonfuzzy) from six categories using multistage fuzzy logic (MFL) and simple mathematical method (SMM). Two experts from PVC and GVC were interviewed to make the model more robust.
author: Muhammad Donny Devanda

authors.name: Rizky Martin, S.Kom, M.Kom
authors.biography: He is a student of Bina Nusantara University majoring in Master of Computer Science. Interested in web development and proficient in using PHP Framework like Laravel, MySQL, HTML, CSS, and also JavaScript. title: MOPROS: Model for Making Project Team
description: DSM was developed using the fuzzy c-means method with 16 parameters used as decision support, where 5 parameters were personality types, and 11 parameters were soft skills.
author: Rizky Martin

title: MOGREEN: Model for Determining Green City
description: Decision Support Model (DSM) based on fuzzy logic to observe the green city in Indonesia. By operating the main method fuzzy slope and multi-stage taking into account six types of categories (i.e. electricity, water, air, building land, transportation, and waste), a DSM for evaluating the green city score was fruitfully executed. In this fuzzy slope, it is a slope calculation that will be an input for each category parameter so that you will get an output for each category in determining a green city. And this multi-stage is the various categories that are carried out in stages or one by one in each category so that when you get an output from each category, that output will become an input in determining green cities and will get a crisp output from each city or known as the green city score.
author: Joshua La'la

title: MOTWEET: Model for Evaluating Tweet
description: This Decision Support Model (DSM) was developed using several stages, namely manual labeling, lexical analysis, and multi-stage fuzzy logic. The DSM utilizes 11 primary parameters, which include severity of harm, violence, hate, aggression, swearing terms, dominant personality, emojis, relationship, imbalance power, repetition, and visibility among peers. The severity of harm parameter is determined using the manual labeling method, while violence, hate, aggression, swearing terms, and dominant personality are analyzed using lexical analysis. The parameters of emojis, relationship, power imbalance, repetition, and visibility among peers are determined using multi-stage fuzzy logic, and each main parameter in the multi-stage fuzzy logic has sub-parameters. The model's primary objective is to distinguish between cyberbullying and banter, which can be challenging due to their close resemblance and frequent misclassification.
author: Darwin Samalo
tag: Manual labeling, lexical analysis, Multi-stage fuzzy logic
